intro: Amorpha glabra, commonly known as silverleaf silktassel, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern and central United States. It is characterized by its grayish-green, lance-shaped leaves and its distinctive, drooping clusters of small, pale green flowers that resemble tassels. The plant produces small, indehiscent pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Amorpha glabra is adapted to a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. It is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in disturbed sites.
